did.unittitle: George Peabody College Photograph Collection

bioghist.head: Biographical:
bioghist.p: John J. Tigert, IV, Feb. 11, 1882.-. Jan. 21, 1965

Psychology, Education, A.B., Vanderbilt University; B.A., Oxford University; M.A., University of Minnesota; LL.D., University of Kentucky; President of University of Florida, 1928-47; Served on White House Conference of Child Health and Protection; Advisory Council, Institute of Pacific Relations; Professor of Philosophy, University of Kentucky, 1911-17; Trustee, Vanderbilt University. Book published: Bishop Holland Nimmons McTyeire.

did.unittitle: Biographical-chronological table of his life and work. 1 container.
Important dates in his life (from paper of Richard Herbert Moorman). Chronology of events and dates (from letters written to Amelia Townsend McTyeire). 1 container
Correspondence-Outgoing.

Outgoing correspondence of 234 letters, 1 card. Chronologically arranged by days and Jnths. Letters are holograph and carbon copies. 1 container. (Microfilmed letters from McTyeire to Garland and letters from Cornelius Vanderbilt to McTyeire.)
Correspondence-Incoming. 1 container.
Incoming correspondence of 207 letters, 1 telegram. Alphabetically arranged. Letters are holograph and carbon copies.
Sermon outlines. 1844-1852. Chronologically arranged by years. 1 container.
Sermon manuscripts. 1 container. Alphabetically arranged by title:

Beauty of Holiness: The Choice of Moses: The Eleventh Hour: Fearing Always: Following the Multitude: God Is Not Slack: Insecurity of Life: Life More Abundantly: The Love of Our Neighbor: National Fast Day; Those Two Sons: The Truth of God: Waiting Patiently upon the Lord.
Addresses and lectures. Chronologically arranged. 1840-1887. 1 container.

My First Speech: Should Emigration be Restricted by Law? Affirmative; Agriculture; Speech at Temperance Meeting in Mobile: Twelve lectures delivered at Demopolis, Alabama: The Flynn-McTyeire Lecture Series; Duties of Christian Masters to Servants: Ministry of Little Children: Address at Foundation of Martin Female College in 1870 (holograph); My Old Servant,11 Uncle Cy11 : Reminiscences of Cokesbury, South Carolina; Address at Re-internment of Bishops McKendree and Soule on Vanderbilt Campus; Debate between H. N. McTyeire and A. M. Shipp.
Newspaper clippings of articles by him.
Last words before leaving: last will and testament.
Material relating to the Methodist Episcopal Church
Books published.

Master and Servant (essay) from Duties of Masters to Servants published 1851 by Southern Baptist Publication Society, Charleston, South carolina: A History of Methodism, published by Southern Methodist Publishing House, Nashville, Tennessee in 1870. These books are cataloged and are in our Special Collections Department.
Miscellaneous materials. 1 container. Materials about McTyeire and others alphabetically arranged by author.

Syllabus-Holland Nimmons McTyeire, Pioneer and Builder: Material from scrapbook of Jane McTyeire Baskerville: H. N. McTyeire, by Hoyt Dobbs: Eminent Methodists by 0. P. Fitzgerald and c. B. Galloway; McTyeire as an Editor; Recollections of McTyeire by Richard Irby; Biography by Thomas McAdory; The Bishop, Holland Nimmons McTyeire, {1824-1889) by Richard Herbert Moorman; Cokesbury School and Conversion by C. E. Peele; South Carolina Conference-Methodist Church, Clemson, South Carolina by John J. Tigert, IV; Recollections (incomplete) by W. A. Teague, student; Tear sheets from Southern Christian Advocate and the Vanderbilt Alumnus.
Memorials, alphabetically arranged. 1 container.
Jane McTyeire Baskerville Scrapbook; Chancellor’s Report; Board of Trust Resolutions; The Christian Advocate; Newspaper references to his death; Tigert Scrapboek; Reminiscences of c. B. Wallace.
Family History. 1 container. Chronologically arranged, principally genealogy.
Tributes. Tributes to members of McTyeire family and others, alphabetically arranged. 1 container.

Tribute to Mary McTyeire Hamilton by Jane McTyeire Baskerville; tribute to Amelia Townsend McTyeire in Christian Advocate; substance of Bishop Fitzgerald’s remarks at her funeral; resolutions by Vanderbilt Board of Trust honoring Amelia Townsend McTyeire; Time magazine’s coverage of war activities of Holland McTyeire (Howlin Mad) Smith; tribute to Frank Crawford Vanderbilt; the Robert Crawford Scholarship Fund for Boys and Girls from Mobile, Alabama;
The Soong Family. Printed matter.
Legal Documents. Sale of property.
Documents relating to appointment of Negro bishop.
Material from scrapbook of Jane McTyeire Baskerville, principally memorials.
Photographs
Documents and papers relating to the founding of Vanderbilt University. Holograph and printed. Chronologically arranged.

Charter of the Central University 1872; Central University of The Methodist Episcopal Church, South, exparte July 1873; Proceedings of the Board of Trust 1873; Resolution accepting gift of $500, 000.00 from Cornelius Vanderbilt, March 26, 1873; Statement of lands of University, May 22, 1873; Synopsis of plans and specifications for new University approved by Cornelius Vanderbilt, Aug. 25, 1873; Dedication of Vanderbilt University, Oct. 3, 1875; Commencement program, June 21, 1876; Receipt for bonds from Cornelius Vanderbilt for $300,000.00, Dec. 8, 1876; Lease of 11 Rokeby': 1880 Program for laying of cornerstone of Wesley Hall, May 4, 1880; Dedication of Wesley Hall, May 8, 1881; Vanderbilt University Commencement Program, May 31, 1882; Information to Theological students; Pamphlet on Biblical Department, 1885-1886; Receipt of $900,000.00 in Lake Shore and Micqigan Southern railway bonds, Feb. 12, 1886; Vanderbilt University versus Whithorne, 1886; Deposition of Holland N. McTyeire in case of Hurt vs Hamilton, Jan. 5, 1887; Statement of case; statement of receipts and disbursement of certain accounts for Vanderbilt University from Sept. 1, 1887-Mar. 12, 1888: Propositions discussed between Nashville College for Young Ladies and the Vanderbilt University Minutes, Vanderbilt Univers ty Board of Trust, Jan. 26, 1872 May 28, 1883: Receipts, contracts, leases involved in building Vanderbilt University: Agreements for the management of Wesley Hall: Early map of campus; eopper plate, Vanderbilt University 1880.
Biographical
Correspondence-Outgoing
Outgoing correspondence of 12 letters. Chronologically arranged. All are holograph.
Correspondence-Incoming.
Incoming correspondence of 14 letters. Alphabetically arranged. Mostly holograph.
Newspaper articles, printed in 1874, with an index.
Printed articles: The Junior Catechism: God in History:
The Original Status of the Methodist Episcopal Church, South. 1 container.
Manuscripts. Alphabetically arranged by title. 1 container.

Andrew Jackson: Ethics, the Science of Duty: The Liberty of Woman: Original Status of Methodist Episcopal. Church, South: Outlines of Christian Doctrine: he Semitic Tongues: The Theory of Knowledge: Was the Christmas Conference a General Conference?
Lecture Notes. 1 container.
Two books of lecture notes, dated Sept. 3, 1878 and Jan. 26, 1888. Chronologically arranged. Holograph.
Minutes and Lectures.
Secretary’s Book, Band of Brothers, Broadway Methodist Episcopal Church, Louisville, Kentucky
Sermons 1 book of sermons (holograph) delivered at Louisville, June 23, 1877.
Books: Life After Death by Fechner: Russell County in Retrospect by Ann Kennedy Walker. These books are cataloged and are in our Special Collections Department.
Correspondence-Outgoing
Outgoing correspondence of 114 letters, 1 telegram, 1 card, undated. Chronologically arranged by days and months. Letters are typewritten, carbon copies.
Correspondence-Incoming.
Incoming correspondence of 219 letters, alphabetically arranged. Holograph and typescript carbon copies.
Introduction to Passing hrough Gates and Other Sermons. Vanderbilt University V Book, Class 1951.
Other Correspondence (by persons other than to or from McTyeire, Tigert, Tigert, IV:)
54 letters. Arranged alphabetically by correspondent. Holograph and typescript.

index.head: INDEX
index.p: This is the name index of the correspondence of the John James Tigert, IV, Collection. The figure (or figures) in parenthesis immediately following each name denotes the total number of letters from that person in the collection; the dates are for the time of the letters. The full name of the writer is given whenever possible; when not given, indicate it. The last number given refers to the box in which the correspondence may be found.
